description:
Base class for tests is not providing helpers for managing mock objects as it does for mox ones (self.mox)

At the moment, the only way to create a mock object and use it is to decorate a test method which is not handy and doesn't allow new contributors to cleary identify that mock is the new framework for testing.
title: Nova should provide helpers for getting a Mock object instead of decorating test methods

comments.content:
Base class for tests is not providing helpers for managing mock objects as it does for mox ones (self.mox)

At the moment, the only way to create a mock object and use it is to decorate a test method which is not handy and doesn't allow new contributors to cleary identify that mock is the new framework for testing.

comments.content:
The reason behind using an Oslo fixture is :
http://www.voidspace.org.uk/python/mock/patch.html#patch-methods-start-and-stop

There is an explicit call to addCleanup() which must be done (we can't rely on tearDown) and so there is a risk that someone is forgetting to write it.


Also, Mox is having its own object in TestCase, why should we explicitely manage by hand mock objects if the only reason is to stick with stdlib ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sylvain-bauza

comments.content:
Change abandoned by Sylvain Bauza (<email address hidden>) on branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/95552
Reason: I understand that's not the best way for handling tests as it possibly obfuscates what is being tested and what is not.

As the patch was only focusing on delivering that method, there is no sense to keep it.
